com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager

Class PdfLayoutMgr

  • com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.PdfLayoutMgr

  • public class PdfLayoutMgr

    Manages a PDF document. You need one of these to do almost anything useful.

    Usage (the unit test is a much better example)

    // Create a new manager
PdfLayoutMgr pageMgr = PdfLayoutMgr.newRgbPageMgr();

PageGrouping lp = pageMgr.startPageGrouping();
// defaults to Landscape orientation
// call various lp.tableBuilder() or lp.put...() methods here.
// They will page-break and create extra physical pages as needed.
// ...
lp.commit();

lp = pageMgr.startPageGrouping(PORTRAIT);
// These pages will be in Portrait orientation
// call various lp methods to put things on the next page grouping
// ...
lp.commit();

// The file to write to
OutputStream os = new FileOutputStream("test.pdf");

// Commit all pages to output stream.
pageMgr.save(os);

    Note:

    Because this class buffers and writes to an underlying stream, it is mutable, has side effects, and is NOT thread-safe!

      org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDDocument getPDDocButBeCareful()
      This returns the wrapped PDDocument instance. This is a highly mutable data structure. Accessing it directly while also using PdfLayoutMgr is inherently unsafe and untested. This method is provided so you can do things like add encryption or use other features of PDFBox not yet directly supported by PdfLayoutMgr.
      Dim getPageDim() 
      boolean hasAnyPages() 
      int hashCode() 
      org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType0Font loadTrueTypeFont(java.io.File fontFile)
      Loads a TrueType font (and embeds it into the document?) from the given file into a PDType0Font object.
      void logicalPageEnd(PageGrouping lp)
      Call this when you are through with your current set of pages to commit all pending text and drawing operations. This is the only method that throws an IOException because the purpose of PdfLayoutMgr is to buffer all operations until a page is complete so that it can safely be written to the underlying stream. This method turns the potential pages into real output. Call when you need a page break, or your document is done and you need to write it out.
      SinglePage page(int idx) 
      void save(java.io.OutputStream os)
      Call this to commit the PDF information to the underlying stream after it is completely built.

      Tells this PdfLayoutMgr that you want to start a new logical page (which may be broken across two or more physical pages) in the requested page orientation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PdfLayoutMgr

        public PdfLayoutMgr(org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.graphics.color.PDColorSpace colorSpace,
                    Dim pageDim,
                    kotlin.jvm.functions.Function2<? super java.lang.Integer,? super com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.pages.SinglePage,java.lang.Float> pageReactor)

        Manages a PDF document. You need one of these to do almost anything useful.

        Usage (the unit test is a much better example)

        // Create a new manager
PdfLayoutMgr pageMgr = PdfLayoutMgr.newRgbPageMgr();

PageGrouping lp = pageMgr.startPageGrouping();
// defaults to Landscape orientation
// call various lp.tableBuilder() or lp.put...() methods here.
// They will page-break and create extra physical pages as needed.
// ...
lp.commit();

lp = pageMgr.startPageGrouping(PORTRAIT);
// These pages will be in Portrait orientation
// call various lp methods to put things on the next page grouping
// ...
lp.commit();

// The file to write to
OutputStream os = new FileOutputStream("test.pdf");

// Commit all pages to output stream.
pageMgr.save(os);

        Note:

        Because this class buffers and writes to an underlying stream, it is mutable, has side effects, and is NOT thread-safe!

        Parameters:
        colorSpace - the color-space for the document. Often PDDeviceCMYK.INSTANCE or PDDeviceRGB.INSTANCE
        pageDim - Returns the width and height of the paper-size where THE HEIGHT IS ALWAYS THE LONGER DIMENSION. You may need to swap these for landscape: pageDim().swapWh(). For this reason, it's not a good idea to use this directly. Use the corrected values through a class PageGrouping instead.
        pageReactor - Takes a page number and returns an x-offset for that page. Use this for effects like page numbering or different offsets or headers/footers for even and odd pages or the start of a chapter.

    • Method Detail

      • getPDDocButBeCareful

        public org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDDocument getPDDocButBeCareful()

        This returns the wrapped PDDocument instance. This is a highly mutable data structure. Accessing it directly while also using PdfLayoutMgr is inherently unsafe and untested. This method is provided so you can do things like add encryption or use other features of PDFBox not yet directly supported by PdfLayoutMgr.

      • logicalPageEnd

        public void logicalPageEnd(PageGrouping lp)

        Call this when you are through with your current set of pages to commit all pending text and drawing operations. This is the only method that throws an IOException because the purpose of PdfLayoutMgr is to buffer all operations until a page is complete so that it can safely be written to the underlying stream. This method turns the potential pages into real output. Call when you need a page break, or your document is done and you need to write it out.

        Throws:
        - if there is a failure writing to the underlying stream.

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
